TypeSignature.Value: public sealed class BluetoothGatt : Java.Lang.Object, Android.Bluetooth.IBluetoothProfile, IDisposable, Java.Interop.IJavaPeerable

.class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit BluetoothGatt extends Java.Lang.Object implements class Android.Bluetooth.IBluetoothProfile, class Android.Runtime.IJavaObject, class Java.Interop.IJavaPeerable, class System.IDisposable
type BluetoothGatt = class inherit Object interface IBluetoothProfile interface IJavaObject interface IDisposable interface IJavaPeerable
public sealed class BluetoothGatt : Java.Lang.Object, Android.Bluetooth.IBluetoothProfile, IDisposable

Docs.summary: Public API for the Bluetooth GATT Profile.

remarks.para: Public API for the Bluetooth GATT Profile.
This class provides Bluetooth GATT functionality to enable communication with Bluetooth Smart or Smart Ready devices.

To connect to a remote peripheral device, create a BluetoothGattCallback and call BluetoothDevice#connectGatt to get a instance of this class. GATT capable devices can be discovered using the Bluetooth device discovery or BLE scan process.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void AbortReliableWrite() cil managed

Docs.summary: Cancels a reliable write transaction for a given device.

remarks.para: Cancels a reliable write transaction for a given device.
Calling this function will discard all queued characteristic write operations for a given remote device.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void AbortReliableWrite(class Android.Bluetooth.BluetoothDevice mDevice) cil managed

Docs.param: To be added.
Docs.summary: This member is deprecated.

remarks.para: This member is deprecated. Use #abortReliableWrite()
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool BeginReliableWrite() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initiates a reliable write transaction for a given remote device.
Docs.returns: true, if the reliable write transaction has been initiated

remarks.para: Initiates a reliable write transaction for a given remote device.

Once a reliable write transaction has been initiated, all calls to #writeCharacteristic are sent to the remote device for verification and queued up for atomic execution. The application will receive a BluetoothGattCallback#onCharacteristicWrite callback in response to every #writeCharacteristic(BluetoothGattCharacteristic, byte[], int) call and is responsible for verifying if the value has been transmitted accurately.

After all characteristics have been queued up and verified, #executeReliableWrite will execute all writes. If a characteristic was not written correctly, calling #abortReliableWrite will cancel the current transaction without committing any values on the remote device.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Close() cil managed

Docs.summary: Close this Bluetooth GATT client.

remarks.para: Close this Bluetooth GATT client.
Application should call this method as early as possible after it is done with this GATT client.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool Connect() cil managed

Docs.summary: Connect back to remote device.
Docs.returns: true, if the connection attempt was initiated successfully

remarks.para: Connect back to remote device.
This method is used to re-connect to a remote device after the connection has been dropped. If the device is not in range, the re-connection will be triggered once the device is back in range.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Connection parameter update - Request the priority preferred for Digital Car Key for a lower latency connection.

remarks.para: Connection parameter update - Request the priority preferred for Digital Car Key for a lower latency connection. This connection parameter will consume more power than BluetoothGatt#CONNECTION_PRIORITY_BALANCED, so it is recommended that apps do not use this unless it specifically fits their use case.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Attribute.AttributeName: [System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Android.Bluetooth.GattConnectionPriority enum directly instead of this field.", true)]
[<System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Android.Bluetooth.GattConnectionPriority enum directly instead of this field.", true)>]

Docs.summary: Connection parameter update - Request a high priority, low latency connection.

remarks.para: Connection parameter update - Request a high priority, low latency connection. An application should only request high priority connection parameters to transfer large amounts of data over LE quickly. Once the transfer is complete, the application should request BluetoothGatt#CONNECTION_PRIORITY_BALANCED connection parameters to reduce energy use.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool DiscoverServices() cil managed

Docs.summary: Discovers services offered by a remote device as well as their characteristics and descriptors.
Docs.returns: true, if the remote service discovery has been started

remarks.para: Discovers services offered by a remote device as well as their characteristics and descriptors.

This is an asynchronous operation. Once service discovery is completed, the BluetoothGattCallback#onServicesDiscovered callback is triggered. If the discovery was successful, the remote services can be retrieved using the #getServices function.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool ExecuteReliableWrite() cil managed

Docs.summary: Executes a reliable write transaction for a given remote device.
Docs.returns: true, if the request to execute the transaction has been sent

remarks.para: Executes a reliable write transaction for a given remote device.
This function will commit all queued up characteristic write operations for a given remote device.
A BluetoothGattCallback#onReliableWriteCompleted callback is invoked to indicate whether the transaction has been executed correctly.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class Android.Bluetooth.BluetoothGattService GetService(class Java.Util.UUID uuid) cil managed

Docs.param: UUID of the requested service
Docs.summary: Returns a BluetoothGattService, if the requested UUID is supported by the remote device.
Docs.returns: BluetoothGattService if supported, or null if the requested service is not offered by the remote device.

remarks.para: Returns a BluetoothGattService, if the requested UUID is supported by the remote device.
This function requires that service discovery has been completed for the given device.
If multiple instances of the same service (as identified by UUID) exist, the first instance of the service is returned.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool ReadCharacteristic(class Android.Bluetooth.BluetoothGattCharacteristic characteristic) cil managed

Docs.param: Characteristic to read from the remote device
Docs.summary: Reads the requested characteristic from the associated remote device.
Docs.returns: true, if the read operation was initiated successfully

remarks.para: Reads the requested characteristic from the associated remote device.
This is an asynchronous operation. The result of the read operation is reported by the BluetoothGattCallback#onCharacteristicRead(BluetoothGatt, BluetoothGattCharacteristic, byte[], int) callback.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool ReadDescriptor(class Android.Bluetooth.BluetoothGattDescriptor descriptor) cil managed

Docs.param: Descriptor value to read from the remote device
Docs.summary: Reads the value for a given descriptor from the associated remote device.
Docs.returns: true, if the read operation was initiated successfully

remarks.para: Reads the value for a given descriptor from the associated remote device.
Once the read operation has been completed, the BluetoothGattCallback#onDescriptorRead callback is triggered, signaling the result of the operation.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool RequestConnectionPriority(valuetype Android.Bluetooth.GattConnectionPriority connectionPriority) cil managed

Docs.param: Request a specific connection priority. Must be one of BluetoothGatt#CONNECTION_PRIORITY_BALANCED, BluetoothGatt#CONNECTION_PRIORITY_HIGHBluetoothGatt#CONNECTION_PRIORITY_LOW_POWER, or BluetoothGatt#CONNECTION_PRIORITY_DCK.
Docs.summary: Request a connection parameter update.

remarks.para: Request a connection parameter update.
This function will send a connection parameter update request to the remote device.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.exception: If the parameters are outside of their specified range.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool RequestMtu(int32 mtu) cil managed

Docs.param: To be added.
Docs.summary: Request an MTU size used for a given connection.
Docs.returns: true, if the new MTU value has been requested successfully

remarks.para: Request an MTU size used for a given connection. Please note that starting from Android 14, the Android Bluetooth stack requests the BLE ATT MTU to 517 bytes when the first GATT client requests an MTU, and disregards all subsequent MTU requests. Check out MTU is set to 517 for the first GATT client requesting an MTU for more information.

When performing a write request operation (write without response), the data sent is truncated to the MTU size. This function may be used to request a larger MTU size to be able to send more data at once.
A BluetoothGattCallback#onMtuChanged callback will indicate whether this operation was successful.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Returns a list of GATT services offered by the remote device.
Docs.value: List of services on the remote device. Returns an empty list if service discovery has not yet been performed.

remarks.para: Returns a list of GATT services offered by the remote device.
This function requires that service discovery has been completed for the given device.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

.method public hidebysig instance bool SetCharacteristicNotification(class Android.Bluetooth.BluetoothGattCharacteristic characteristic, bool enable) cil managed

Docs.param: The characteristic for which to enable notifications
Set to true to enable notifications/indications
Docs.summary: Enable or disable notifications/indications for a given characteristic.
Docs.returns: true, if the requested notification status was set successfully

remarks.para: Enable or disable notifications/indications for a given characteristic.

Once notifications are enabled for a characteristic, a BluetoothGattCallback#onCharacteristicChanged(BluetoothGatt, BluetoothGattCharacteristic, byte[]) callback will be triggered if the remote device indicates that the given characteristic has changed.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: public void SetPreferredPhy (Android.Bluetooth.BluetoothPhy txPhy, Android.Bluetooth.BluetoothPhy rxPhy, Android.Bluetooth.BluetoothPhyOption phyOptions);

.method public hidebysig instance void SetPreferredPhy(valuetype Android.Bluetooth.BluetoothPhy txPhy, valuetype Android.Bluetooth.BluetoothPhy rxPhy, valuetype Android.Bluetooth.BluetoothPhyOption phyOptions) cil managed
member this.SetPreferredPhy : Android.Bluetooth.BluetoothPhy * Android.Bluetooth.BluetoothPhy * Android.Bluetooth.BluetoothPhyOption -> unit

Docs.param: preferred transmitter PHY. Bitwise OR of any of BluetoothDevice#PHY_LE_1M_MASK, BluetoothDevice#PHY_LE_2M_MASK, and BluetoothDevice#PHY_LE_CODED_MASK.
preferred receiver PHY. Bitwise OR of any of BluetoothDevice#PHY_LE_1M_MASK, BluetoothDevice#PHY_LE_2M_MASK, and BluetoothDevice#PHY_LE_CODED_MASK.
preferred coding to use when transmitting on the LE Coded PHY. Can be one of BluetoothDevice#PHY_OPTION_NO_PREFERRED, BluetoothDevice#PHY_OPTION_S2 or BluetoothDevice#PHY_OPTION_S8
Docs.summary: Set the preferred connection PHY for this app.

remarks.para: Set the preferred connection PHY for this app. Please note that this is just a recommendation, whether the PHY change will happen depends on other applications preferences, local and remote controller capabilities. Controller can override these settings.
BluetoothGattCallback#onPhyUpdate will be triggered as a result of this call, even if no PHY change happens. It is also triggered when remote device updates the PHY.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

This member is deprecated. Use BluetoothGatt#writeCharacteristic(BluetoothGattCharacteristic, byte[], int) as this is not memory safe because it relies on a BluetoothGattCharacteristic object whose underlying fields are subject to change outside this method.

Docs.returns: true, if the write operation was initiated successfully

remarks.para: Write the value of a given descriptor to the associated remote device.
A BluetoothGattCallback#onDescriptorWrite callback is triggered to report the result of the write operation.

This member is deprecated. Use BluetoothGatt#writeDescriptor(BluetoothGattDescriptor, byte[]) as this is not memory safe because it relies on a BluetoothGattDescriptor object whose underlying fields are subject to change outside this method.
